title: Matrix Operations Basics Quiz
description: Test your understanding of basic matrix operations including addition, scalar multiplication, and matrix properties.

questions.question: What is the result of adding matrices A and B where A = [1 2; 3 4] and B = [5 6; 7 8]?
questions.explanation: Matrix addition is performed element-wise: (A + B)[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j]

questions.question: If matrix A has dimensions 2×3 and matrix B has dimensions 2×3, what are the dimensions of A + B?
questions.explanation: Matrix addition requires both matrices to have the same dimensions, and the result has the same dimensions.

questions.question: What is the result of scalar multiplication 3 × [2 4; 1 3]?
questions.explanation: Scalar multiplication multiplies each element by the scalar: (k × A)[i][j] = k × A[i][j]

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a property of matrix addition?
options: Distributive: A × (B + C) = A × B + A × C
questions.explanation: The distributive property applies to scalar multiplication over matrix addition, not matrix multiplication over matrix addition.

questions.question: What are the dimensions of a matrix with 3 rows and 4 columns?
questions.explanation: Matrix dimensions are always written as rows × columns.
